item.name: Introduction
item.description: Shows a simple FlexGrid bound to a tabular dataset. At runtime, by default, end-users can sort columns, resize columns, reorder columns, select cells and edit cells by double-clicking.

item.name: Transposed Grid
item.description: You can easily transpose FlexGrid by just setting one property. A transposed datagrid flips the rows and columns so that the headers display down the left side and rows display horizontally across the application.

item.name: Virtual Scrolling
item.description: Incremental loading, or on-demand loading, is a powerful feature for applications where data is loaded in chunks as the user scrolls down a list in real time. This feature is supported using the C1VirtualDataCollection component which is part of the C1DataCollection library.

item.name: Cell Merging
item.description: FlexGrid can automatically merge cells down columns or across rows based on the cell contents. There are several different merging rules which you can specify.

item.name: Custom Cell Merging
item.description: In addition to automatic cell merging, you can create custom cell merging across columns and down rows simultaneously. This demo shows a TV schedule.

item.name: Custom Cells
item.description: The OwnerDrawCell event allows you to customize the way each cell is rendered. You can modify some elements of the cell, such as text color, or override the painting completely as shown in this demo that draws progress bars.

item.name: Hover Style
item.description: Configure the cells to highlight when the mouse moves over them with FlexGrid's hover style. You can have the hover style set for individual cell, row or column.

item.name: Selection
item.description: The FlexGrid selection experience is heavily inspired by Microsoft Excel. Users can select multiple cells across rows and columns, select multiple non-adjacent rows, or limit the selection to a single row or cell.

item.name: Selection Statistics
item.description: FlexGrid can automatically generate the statistics of the users selection including count, average, and sum.

item.name: Column Footers
item.description: Footers can be shown in FlexGrid columns as a fixed, additional row. Footers can show calculated values like sum, average, min, or max, or values based on cross-column expressions.

item.name: Column Picker
item.description: This demo shows a custom column picker which lets users show and hide available columns. Click the gear icon to display the column picker.

item.name: Column Pinning
item.description: Pinned columns are automatically moved to the left and frozen during scroll. FlexGrid supports pinning a single column (top grid) or a multiple column range (bottom grid).

item.name: Column Sizing
item.description: FlexGrid supports different column sizing techniques. Columns can have fixed sizes or automatic sizes based on content and available space. Star-sizing allows you to specify the width of a column with respect to the total available width. With star-sizing you can achieve a fully responsive datagrid.

item.name: Freezing
item.description: FlexGrid supports freezing rows and columns both from code and by the end-user. Frozen rows or columns remain in place as the user scrolls, keeping important data in view.

item.name: Sparklines
item.description: The Sparkline property of the column is used for sparkline customization. You can change the sparkline type, colors, line weight and distance between bars.

item.name: Transposed Grid
item.description: You can easily transpose FlexGrid by just setting one property. A transposed datagrid flips the rows and columns so that the headers display down the left side and rows display horizontally across the application.

item.name: Column Bands
item.description: Column bands provide a simple and convenient way to organize FlexGrid's columns into logical and collapsible groups.

item.name: Column Bands Layout
item.description: This demo shows how you can quickly switch between different column band views.

item.name: Multi-Row Bands
item.description: Multi-row column bands allow you to organize your data into a complex layout where each FlexGrid row is rendered with multiple rows of data.

item.name: Order Management
item.description: This demo shows column bands with grouping to show an Order Management view.

item.name: Column Editors
item.description: FlexGrid for WinForms supports numerous types of custom editors. This demo shows common column data types and their desired editors. Double-click within a cell to edit its contents.

item.name: Unbound
item.description: FlexGrid is designed for optional performance in both bound and unbound modes. When working with an unbound FlexGrid, you have complete control over column behavior. In this demo, use the form to enter Proceeds and Payments to see calculated results.

item.name: Validation
item.description: Show errors directly on the FlexGrid. Validate data with the built-in formatting, or use unobtrusive validation to validate as the user types.

item.name: Filtering
item.description: FlexGrid provides built-in filters similar to Excel that allow filtering most data types easily and efficiently. Value filters show a checklist of values present in the column. Conditional filters allow the user to define the filter using AND and OR conditions. This demo shows text, numeric and custom filtering.

item.name: Filtering by Inheritance
item.description: This demo shows how you can customize the FlexGrid’s column filters using inheritance and composition from code.

item.name: Search Panel
item.description: The FlexGrid Search Panel offers search across all data bound to the FlexGrid. Search options let you highlight the results.

item.name: Grouping
item.description: Create a hierarchical view of your data by grouping. FlexGrid for WPF supports dynamic grouping by code with aggregated summaries and customizable group header text.

item.name: Grouping Panel
item.description: Create a hierarchical view of your data by grouping. The optional grouping panel lets the end-user fully manage multi-level grouping by dragging column headers into the panel above the control.

item.name: Subtotals
item.description: Use the Subtotal method to automatically calculate totals for individual columns. When the user drags a column header to a different position, the grid instantly reorganizes the data and recalculates the subtotals.

item.name: Tree Grid
item.description: FlexGrid can behave as a tree view. It has the expected features of a tree view pluse those of an extensive data grid. Users can drag items, perform sorts, insert new items, edit text inline, and even print.

item.name: Loading Data
item.description: FlexGrid is capable of handling millions of records and includes a few tricks for getting optimal performance. For instance, set the Redraw property to false before data binding to prevent the grid from painting during load time. Set the AutoResize property to false to turn off expensive column and row sizing.

item.name: Scrolling
item.description: You can improve performance for large data sets by enabling deferred scrolling. When scrolling is deferred, the FlexGrid does not continuously redraw during scroll actions, thus greatly improving performance. You can also display scroll tips to help the user know where they are within the dataset.

item.name: Virtual Scrolling
item.description: Incremental loading, or on-demand loading, is a powerful feature for applications where data is loaded in chunks as the user scrolls down a list in real time. This feature is supported using the C1VirtualDataCollection component which is part of the C1DataCollection library.

item.name: Export and Print
item.description: Working with Excel: Save and load data directly from Microsoft Excel. FlexGrid supports many different exporting options, such as formatting, fixed cells, merged cells, mapped values, and more. Printing: Directly print FlexGrid while optionally showing preview and progress dialogs. For more control over printing, FlexGrid has a custom Printable class which can be used to combine multiple grids in one document to add surrounding content.

item.name: Export to PDF
item.description: This demo marks selected rows and columns as break points, then breaks the grid into several images and renders them to a PDF for printing and sharing.

item.name: Basic Row Details
item.description: Drill into a row of data to show more details inside a collapsible panel. You can display an input form, a child data grid, or anything else within the detail row.

item.name: Custom Row Details
item.description: To customize the appearance or functionality of the standard detail row, you can derive the new row detail control and override one or more virtual methods to create a fully custom detail.

item.name: Input Panel
item.description: Use the Row Details to provide an input form to edit child details directly on the selected row. This demo uses the C1InputPanel control.

item.name: Nested Grid
item.description: Use the Row Details feature to create a nested datagrid by placing another FlexGrid into the row details provider.
